title.narrative: OUTPUT 9.2 MEDIA FOR CHILD RIGHTS

description.narrative: Output 8.2: The media in Yemen have strengthened capacity to report responsibly and ethically on the situation and rights of all children, which contributes to Communication And Advocacy, Cross-Sectoral - Human Rights, Cross-Sectoral - Other Programme Areas. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, UNICEF is better positioned as a leading child rights advocate in the humanitarian and development landscape, with adequate funding in support of the country programme

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 8.2: The media in Yemen have strengthened capacity to report responsibly and ethically on the situation and rights ofall children

description.narrative: The Communication section continues to engage with media in Yemen to strengthen their capacity to report responsibly and ethically on the situation and rights of children in Yemen. Active engagement with national, regional and international media is also central to ensure reputational risk is minimized and UNICEF is well positioned as the voice of children in Yemen. YCO also upscaled its presence on social media platforms to reach and engage more with its target audience and highlight key partnerships including donors contributions. | Status:Met | As-of Date:07/01/2022
